{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3383525,"name":"asa","username":"AngleSideAngle","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/anglesideangle/{size}/179617_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-10T11:34:33.799Z","cooked":"

With the new radio supporting up to 4 ethernet connections (1 rio 1 tether 2 coproc), does your team intend to continue using a network switch in the 2025+ season?

  • yes
  • no

Why would we asa

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2024-05-10T11:39:33.900Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":471,"readers_count":470,"score":99.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":465845,"topic_slug":"network-switch-in-2025","display_username":"Max H.","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60329,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robotics Addict"},"post_url":"/t/network-switch-in-2025/465845/2","custom_user_title":"Robotics Addict","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3383538,"name":"Nicholas ","username":"unident","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/unident/{size}/188354_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-10T11:55:25.283Z","cooked":"

our team has never had a problem with running any of the common 10/100 5 port switches seen in FRC, but an eliminated component is always optimal, especially something all of your robot communication traffic goes through. For custom vision solutions, you can run quite a few cameras before you will start to need a 3rd port, which is likely what we will stick with, if the next season relies heavily on accurate pose.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2024-05-10T11:55:25.283Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":446,"readers_count":445,"score":124.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":465845,"topic_slug":"network-switch-in-2025","display_username":"Nicholas ","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55833,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/network-switch-in-2025/465845/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3383562,"name":"","username":"AGreatUsernameChoice","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/agreatusernamechoice/{size}/190081_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-10T12:24:20.654Z","cooked":"

Last season, we had wired our RIO into a network switch so we could connect it to the first Ethernet port on the radio. It was meant to solve our cameras dropping, but apparently companies don’t design professional networking solutions for high-impact activities. For some reason.

Uh, anyways, we plan to use an Orange Pi for odometry and a Limelight 3 for game piece detection. That still leaves us an Ethernet port for DS needs.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2024-05-10T12:24:20.654Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":412,"readers_count":411,"score":107.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":465845,"topic_slug":"network-switch-in-2025","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":58001,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"6964 Programming Lead"},"post_url":"/t/network-switch-in-2025/465845/4","custom_user_title":"6964 Programming Lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3383573,"name":"Joseph Walters","username":"Jwal","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jwal/{size}/228161_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-10T12:36:57.898Z","cooked":"

I voted YES, but its more of a “it depends” situation!

For Co-Proc’s we are transitioning to Orange Pi’s, but can still see potential value in our limelights. If we need to run our Orange Pi and more than 1 extra limelight depending on the situation/game, we have a space-claim allocated for a 5 port network switch.

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":10,"updated_at":"2024-05-10T12:36:57.898Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":360,"readers_count":359,"score":107.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":465845,"topic_slug":"network-switch-in-2025","display_username":"Joseph Walters","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":63541,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/network-switch-in-2025/465845/5","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3383645,"name":"Rich Jr","username":"rich.varone","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/rich.varone/{size}/167373_2.png","created_at":"2024-05-10T14:15:13.548Z","cooked":"

Same here, voted yes but it’s a it depends. With the stricter mounting requirements of the new radio one reason we might run a switch has to do more with where and how to run all the ethernet cables to make cable management easier.

This is true, and was why we were curious what other teams intended to do. I’m still not sure if the better/less exposed wiring is worth 2-3 additional points of failure for the entire robot, even if it hasn’t caused us issues in the past.
